    Erik Pillon presents: Fun with Flags

    The following questions were asked during the special round “Erik Pillon presents: Fun with Flags” of the pubquiz on the 9th of September, 2022.

    • Question: How many countries in the world have square flags?
      Answer: Switzerland and Vatican City
    • Question: There are only 3 countries in the world that have a dragon in their flag. Name one.
      Answer: Bhutan, Wales, Malta
    • Question: Only two countries have their map on their flag. Name one.
      Answer: Kosovo and Cyprus
    • Question: Which National Flags display a Lion?
      Answer: Bermuda, Jersey, Spain, Sri Lanka, and Luxembourg
    • Question: It is normally a criminal offence to mutilate or burn the national flag. There’s only one reason why you can burn the US flag. Which is?
      Answer: It can’t be fixed or is dirty upon cleaning
    • Question: The flag of Paraguay has the unique feature of what?
      Answer:
    • Question: Which is the most common color on national flags?
      Answer: Red, 105 flags. Red symbolizes bravery and sufferance, blue Sky-Ocean but also Peace and freedom, Black: self-determinism ethnic heritage
    • Question: How many colors are there in the South African Flag?
      Answer: Six: Black, Yellow, Green, White, Black, Red, Blue
    • Question: Which country has the oldest flag?
      Answer: first used in 1925, the design goes back to 1219
    • Question: Which is the only flag in the world that doesn’t have 4 edges?
      Answer: Nepal
